intro: Scabiosa columbaria subsp. columbaria, commonly known as the nodding scabious, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, gray-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or purple flowers with a distinctive central boss, resembling a "scabious" appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, sandy or loamy soils. This species is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, contributing to its ecological and ornamental value.
